com.cubeia.firebase.api.login.jdbc
Class JDBCLoginService

java.lang.Object
  com.cubeia.firebase.api.login.jdbc.JDBCLoginService
All Implemented Interfaces:
LoginLocator, Initializable<ServiceContext>, Startable, Contract, Service
public class JDBCLoginService
extends Object
implements LoginLocator, Service

This is a simple service implementation looking for user names and passwords from a database table. Configuration for this service is done in the cluster configuration file. The following properties apply: 

                service.login.data-source - deployed data source name
                service.login.table-name - database table to use
                service.login.id-column - user id column name
                service.login.user-column - user name column name
                service.login.password-column - user password column name
All properties needs to be supplied. The data source must be sucessfully deployed. The service should depend on ClusterConfigProviderContract and DatasourceServiceContract. A service xml is included in the same package as this class. Errors will appear in the log when running if the data source cannot be found.

Author:
Larsan

init

public void init(ServiceRegistry serviceRegistry)
Description copied from interface: LoginLocator
This method is called if the login locator is configured rather than mounted as a service. Since the service has access to the system it is recommended that service mounting is preferable.

NB:Please note that this method will not be called if the locator is mounted as a service.

NB 2:This method will be removed in Firebase 1.9

Specified by:
init in interface LoginLocator
Parameters:
serviceRegistry - Service registry, never null

init

public void init(ServiceContext con)
          throws SystemException
Description copied from interface: Initializable
Initialize component. Normally, this method will swallow all transient errors. If the component fails hard, and cannot continue it should throw a system exception, for top level components. If this method throws an exception, the component is guaranteed to never be started.
